result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Richtig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian J. Richtig is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian J. Richtig was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Must pay child support as ordered. 
Must notify child support office of address and employment within 48 hours.    
Must be employed 35 hours a week and if unemployed diligent job search. Must do 3 job searches per week, must apply for something that defendant is qualified for.  Must file report with Probation and Parole and Child Support office.  
Must file tax returns and copies to be filed with probation and parole and child support.  
AODA and follow through all recommendations.  
May not enter any bars or taverns.  
May not possess or consume alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed. 
Stay can be lifted in full or part by order upon the court based upon the violation of conditions.  Child support may be modified.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian J. Richtig

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian J. Richtig in court, in custody.  Douglas Drexler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation is requesting the stay be lifted to serve his remainder of his 10 months jail time.   Court lifts stay, must serve remainder of time in Florence County Jail.
Letter from Mr. Keller
Probation review hearing on February 15, 2018 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Withdrawal of Huber privilages
Modification to Conditions of Probation

Defendant Brian J. Richtig in court, in custody.  Douglas j Drexler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called 10:13 a.m.  Statement from the court.  Statement from Defendant.  Court questions Mr. Richtig regarding letter from Mr. Keller.  Must serve 60 days in jail at this time.  If court receives another letter, warnings given.  If he has a job and can work with Dept. of Corrections to get probation transferred to Keil, may serve time in that county with huber so he can pay child support.  tln
Finger Print/DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Brian J. Richtig in court with attorney Henry Francis Mcroberts.  Douglas j Drexler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 1 plea of No contest, Count 2 dismissed.    Plea is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently given.    Constitutional rights read and waived.  Found guilty.  Statement by the State.  Statement by Child Support Agency.  Statement by Attorney McRoberts.  Statement by Defendant.  Statement by Court.  Court sentences:  3 years probation, sentence imposed 3.5 years in prison, 1.5 initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision.  Condition of probaation, 1 year jail stayed; Stayed can be lifted in full or part by order upon the court based upon the violation of conditions, child support may be modified.  Court costs, 60 days to pay or CO.   Must pay child support as ordered. Must notify child support office of address and employment within 48 hours.    Must be employed 35 hours a week and if unemployed diligent job search. Must do 3 job searches per week, must apply for something that defendant is qualified for.  Must file report with Probation and Parole and Child Support office.  Must file tax returns and copies to be filed with probation and parole and child support.  AODA and follow through all recommendations.  May not enter any bars or taverns.  May not possess or consume alcohol. Felon stats given.  arg.  tln
